meanings.definition: To resign from a job or position.
meanings.sent1: She decided to demit her role as team leader.
meanings.sent2: He will demit his duties at the end of the month.
meanings.sent3: The cat pretended to demit its role as the ruler of the house.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to demit its brightness as the storm approached.
meanings.sent5: The decision to demit her position left a void in the company.

meanings.sent1: Please demit the package to the courier for delivery.
meanings.sent2: He demitted the responsibility to his assistant.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to demit the rabbit to his hat, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: The key seemed to demit its power to unlock the mystery.
meanings.sent5: She demitted the task to her colleague with a smile.

meanings.definition: To reduce in rank or status.
meanings.sent1: The general had to demit his position due to the scandal.
meanings.sent3: The cake seemed to demit its status as the favorite dessert at the party.
meanings.sent4: The demit of the once mighty empire was a lesson in humility.
meanings.sent5: The demit of his title left him feeling lost and unsure.
